private.translation[0].definitions[0].de: for use by one person or group, not for everyone
private.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He made some notes for his private use.
Many communists objected to any form of private property.
private.translation[0].definitions[1].de: not related to, owned by, or paid for by the government
private.translation[0].definitions[1].no: go private British English (=pay for medical treatment instead of getting it free at a public hospital)
private.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: There is private ownership of property in a market economy.
private.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a private meeting, conversation etc involves only two people or a small number of people, and is not for other people to know about
private.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I need to have a private discussion with you.
Are you alone? I just wanted a private word.
private.translation[0].definitions[3].de: private feelings, information, or opinions are personal or secret and not for other people to know about
private.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Jack’s private opinion was that she was selfish.
private.translation[0].definitions[4].de: used about someone who is not known to the public or not working for the government or another organization
private.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: The painting was sold to a private collector.
Seven police and three private individuals needed medical attention.
private.translation[0].definitions[5].de: separate from and not related to your work or your official position
private.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: The president is paying a private visit to Europe.
He enjoys everything he does in both his professional and his private life.
private.translation[0].definitions[6].de: quiet and without a lot of people
private.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: Why don’t we go upstairs where it’s more private?
private.translation[0].definitions[7].de: a private person is one who likes being alone, and does not talk much about their thoughts or feelings
private.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: private
if something is private, you do not want most people to know about it because it concerns your feelings, your relationships etc
He didn’t want to discuss his private life.
What happens in the bedroom is strictly private.
personal
relating to your private life – used especially about problems, feelings, and questions
They asked a lot of personal questions.
She talked about her own personal feelings.
I’d rather not talk about it – it’s personal.
The singer has had a lot of problems in her personal life.
secret
used about feelings and thoughts that you do not tell anyone about
Barclay had a secret desire to become an actor.
His secret fear was that Jenny would leave him.
intimate
very private – used about things relating to your relationships and sexual feelings
an intimate conversation
Many people share intimate details of their lives on the Internet.
their intimate moments together
innermost
your innermost feelings, thoughts etc are your most private ones
Counselling often encourages you to reveal your innermost thoughts.
be none of somebody’s business
if something is none of your business, it is private and you should not ask about it
It’s none of your business how much I earn.
‘Are you married?’ ‘That’s none of your business.’
private.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a soldier of the lowest rank
private.translation[2].definitions[0].de: private property, businesses, activities etc are owned or paid for by people and companies, rather than the government
private.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: They transferred ownership of thousands of companies from the state to the private sector (=the part of the economy not owned by the government).
Investment bankers say that private money should be used for new municipal projects.
private.translation[2].definitions[1].de: involving something that is sold directly to people or organizations, without being offered openly for anyone to buy
private.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The company has raised $50 million in a private placement arranged by Kemper Financial Services.
Goldman will seek new sources of capital through a private investment offering.
a private sale of 70 million shares, to be offered to investment institutions at A$2.55 each
private.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: Slovak officials approved proposals to put 200 companies in private hands.
private.translation[2].definitions[3].de: belonging to a member of the public rather than to an organization
private.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: There are more than 100 million handguns in private hands in the US.
private.translation[2].definitions[4].de: if a government-owned organization goes or turns private, it is sold to investors
private.translation[2].definitions[4].ex: Iberia Airlines will be ready to go private next year.
Poland’s remaining state enterprises have put forward plans to turn private.
private.translation[2].definitions[5].de: to pay for medical treatment instead of getting it free at a public hospital
private.translation[2].definitions[6].de: a private company does not make its shares available for anyone to buy on a stockmarket
private.translation[2].definitions[6].ex: Cargill, the largest private company in the US, wants to stay that way. Says Mr West, a vice president: ‘We’ll go public  (=sell shares on the stockmarket) the week after snowballs form in hell.’
private.translation[2].definitions[7].de: if a company with shares on the stockmarket goes private, its owners buy back those shares from existing shareholders so that it becomes privately owned
private.translation[2].definitions[7].ex: The majority of companies that went private in the last few years will become public again by reselling stock.
private.translation[2].definitions[8].de: if a company’s owners take it private, they buy back all shares from existing shareholders
private.translation[2].definitions[8].ex: The company’s chairman plans to take the company private through a buy-out of the 74% of shares he doesn’t already own.
private.translation[2].definitions[9].de: only for use by one particular person or group, not for everyone
private.translation[2].definitions[10].d: a private meeting, agreement, conversation etc involves only a small number of people and is kept secret
private.translation[2].definitions[10].e: Mr. Miscio rose to protest, saying ‘This is a private meeting’.
The visit was preceded by a private audience  (=a meeting with someone important) for the chairmen.
